ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3-5 hours/week
8-10 hours
4-5 hours
10-12 hrs/wk
Depending on the week, can range from 2-8
20 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I loved this course. It provided enough theory and structure to not feel intimidated by the project assignments but enough free-range to problem solve and learn from real-world challenges.
Strengths: real world training, group work, chance to give feedback during our last class, final presentation, interaction with communities(weakness: textbook)
Very good, practical, hands on experience.
The course is very interesting and well-structured, and also allows students to pursue independent interests.

Good course. There was too much class time for a practicum. There should be less class time. That time would be better spent allowing students to work on their project. Professor and TA were committed and very kind.
more engaging reading material
so great! love the hands-on experience.

This is a great opportunity to do a project with a community organization. I was truly lucky to have the opportunity to use the skills I learned in biostats and applied analytic methods in epidemiology (aamie) in order to help a real organization. You get the opportunity to network with the community and gain experience working in a group project.Ways to improve: Make the class 1 hour instead of 2 hours. The first hour can be for teaching and the second hour should be for group work. Many of the things that were taught in class could have been condensed into one hour.
Much workload as a team.

Great opportunity to connect students to outside organizations; nice having a class that is practice-based rather than homework and exam based; the work load was heavy in the beginning and again at the end which is understandable due to the structure of the course and limited time to get the projects done; a different book is recommended and shorter reading assignments; the lectures with the TAs about how to treat each other and to deal with snooty emails from group members made me feel like I was in elementary school- I think this time could have been better utilized just by giving the groups more classroom time to work on our projects
It's a great course but with a lot of workload
We learned a lot of good methods and skills for working with community organizations, however, a lot of what we learned was not relevant to each of our projects.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie is wonderfully articulate, animated and engaging. She is clear with her expectations while also supportive and understanding when groups face unique obstacles.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Very kind, dedicated, knowledgeable instructor.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Excellent teacher with broad knowledge and experience. Great enthusiasm.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Dr. Humphries is clearly very committed to the course, the projects and her students. She was an excellent instructor.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Very kind professor. Very knowledgable and committed.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  great communicatorcould have been more involved in the subject matter of our project
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  fantastic. such a unique thinker compared to other professors. really cares about how students absorb information. picks unique readings and stories.

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie is sweet and passionate. Her love for community program building is evidence through her lectures and discussions. She was also available and willing to help. My only suggestion for improvement would be to make half of the class groupwork time. Regardless of this, Debbie did all she could in order to be receptive to the class's feedback.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Really nice and kind.

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Incredibly knowledgeable and always available for meeting one-on-one; not that great at coming up with engaging class lectures- I think this could be improved with a different book and better material to work with; did a good job trying to centralize the lectures given that every group was doing something different
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  She is a great instructor who is dedicated to this course

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Benjamin Richard Clopper  Ben was helpful and encouraging when we needed clarification or feedback on assignments. He was accessible and a reassuring resource.
Instructor: Benjamin Richard Clopper  very good support.
Instructor: Benjamin Richard Clopper  generous with time and feedbackquick email turnaround
Instructor: Benjamin Richard Clopper  Great guy and really helpful; I wish he could have been more direct at times with how we should conduct our project but overall very helpful and professional
Instructor: Benjamin Richard Clopper  He is a great TA
Instructor: Crystal Denise Gibson  Crystal was very available and provided extremely helpful feedback and support.

Instructor: Crystal Denise Gibson  Crystal was always extremely available and attentive! Always willing to help and look things over for us. Crystal's knowledge, experience, and advice definitely allowed us to succeed with our project. It also helps that Crystal has a great personality.
Instructor: Mary Rose D'Alimonte  It was a great pleasure to work with Mary.
Instructor: Mary Rose D'Alimonte  Very kind and responsive.
Instructor: Mary Rose D'Alimonte  so helpful! always quick to reply.
Instructor: Mary Rose D'Alimonte  Really helpful.
Instructor: Mary Rose D'Alimonte  Mary was very helpful for getting us on a solid footing for our project.
Instructor: Mary Rose D'Alimonte  Mary is amazing.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The IRB process is frustrating, but after that, the projects are engaging and lectures entertaining.
Take this course to get real world experience in community health program planning.
definitely take this course if looking to have more practical applications of public health work
Excellent practical experience.
If there is a project that interests a student that semester, I would recommend the student take this course.
teaches process more than method
take it! one of the few practice based courses and one of the best professors at YSPH. real world experience you can't get in other courses.

Your whole course experience will most be based on the project you get involved with and your team. If you are not interested in your project of your team doesn't get along well..then your experience won't be the best. Debbie does a great job at teaching, over sometimes the lectures can feel way too long. This is why I recommend Debbie teach less and have more groupwork time. In all. I only recommend this course if you are truly interested in the projects.
Much workload as a team. I need to take it. But I would not take it if it were not necessary for graduation.
Do it- just be ready to have a LOT of independent and outside work
Recommend it.
